title: General Knowledge Quiz IV (50 Questions)
description: Challenging but fair across pop culture, history, science, geography, and tech. No sports content.

items.q: Which stage musical features the song “Defying Gravity”?
Who wrote the novel Pride and Prejudice?
Which film introduced the character Captain Jack Sparrow?
items.a: Pirates of the Caribbean: The Curse of the Black Pearl

items.q: In Pokémon, what is the name of the electric mouse mascot?
Who created the comic strip Peanuts?
Which TV series is set in the fictional town of Hawkins, Indiana?
Who sang “Like a Rolling Stone” in 1965?
Which artist painted The Starry Night?
In Marvel stories, what metal coats Wolverine’s skeleton?
Which guitarist performed a famous rendition of the U.S. national anthem at Woodstock (1969)?
Who was the first woman to fly solo across the Atlantic Ocean?
Which ancient wonder stood in the city of Alexandria?
Which pandemic of the 14th century was caused by Yersinia pestis?
Who became the first Chancellor of a unified Germany in 1871?
Which 1954 U.S. Supreme Court case ended legal school segregation?
Which treaty ended the American Revolutionary War?
Which Egyptian queen allied with Julius Caesar and Mark Antony?
What writing material, made from reeds, was used in ancient Egypt?
Who led the Bolsheviks during the October Revolution?
Which Chinese dynasty built much of the Great Wall seen today?
What is the chemical symbol for potassium?
What is the largest species of shark?
What phenomenon causes a straw to appear bent in water?
Which part of the brain coordinates movement and balance?
What type of rock forms from cooled magma or lava?
Which planet has the most prominent ring system?
What is the process where a solid transitions directly to a gas?
What is the pH of pure water at 25 °C?
What is the primary function of red blood cells?
What is the SI base unit for electric current?
What is the capital of South Korea?
Marrakech is a major city in which country?
What is the highest waterfall in the world (uninterrupted drop)?
Which desert spans Botswana, Namibia, and South Africa?
Which river runs through Baghdad?
What is the name of the islands off Ecuador famed for unique wildlife?
Which European capital is built on 14 islands linked by bridges?
What is Africa’s deepest lake?
Which country is nicknamed the “Land of the Rising Sun”?
What strait separates Asia from North America?
What was the first widely used graphical web browser?
What does RAM stand for?
Which social app’s logo is a stylized ghost?
What household device uses a magnetron to generate microwaves?
What does PDF stand for?
Which programming language is named after a British comedy troupe?
What does SMS stand for?
What is the small text file websites store to remember preferences?
What is the modern reversible USB connector standard?
What security technique encodes passwords into fixed‑length strings?
